protein.general_function: Involved in nucleoside transmembrane transporter activity
protein.specific_function: Mediates both influx and efflux of nucleosides across the membrane (equilibrative transporter). Mediates transport of adenine, adenosine and uridine, as well as several nucleoside analog drugs, such as anticancer and antiviral agents, including cladribine, cordycepin, tubercidin and AZT. Does not transport hypoxanthine

go_class.description: nucleobase, nucleoside, nucleotide and nucleic acid transmembrane transporter activity

reference.reference_text: Hyde RJ, Cass CE, Young JD, Baldwin SA: The ENT family of eukaryote nucleoside and nucleobase transporters: recent advances in the investigation of structure/function relationships and the identification of novel isoforms. Mol Membr Biol. 2001 Jan-Mar;18(1):53-63.
